threads.com:
Nozomu Itoshiki is depressed. Very depressed. He’s certifiably suicidal, but he’s also the beloved schoolteacher of a class of unique students, each charming in her own way: The stalker. The shut-in. The obsessive-compulsive. The girl who comes to class every day with strange bruises. And Kafuka, the most optimistic girl in the world, who knows that every cloud has a silver lining. For all of them, it’s a special time, when the right teacher can have a lasting positive effect on their lives. But is that teacher Itoshiki, a.k.a. Zetsubou-sensei, who just wants to find the perfect place to die?

Holy shit, this is the first time in a long time an anime ending has made me angry. What the fuck was the last 10 minutes? Can you say anticlimactic? The epic battle, philosophical mumbo jumbo, etc. comes to an end and then...what...I can't even. Imagine star wars episode 6 but when Luke gets back to Endor he gets beat up by rogue ewoks and then the movie abruptly ends. The stupid fucking lizard retard who wanted to kill humans beats up the protagonist in a scene that seems to go on forever...then we're supposed to be feel sorry for him...then he starts raging again...and then the fish girl who was saved by the protagonist and we've come to care for acts all concerned about the lizard retard and disappears into the sea with him like his concerned lover despite him abusing her and banishing her earlier on and never showing a single redeeming quality whatsoever.
The end. Whooo!
Fuck whoever wrote that. Holy shit. Biggest last minute turn into total dogshit I've ever seen. It was bad enough that we were supposed to be understanding of Zorndyke killing billions of people a few minutes earlier but this was just painful to watch.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
This is the story of a mangaka that thought he would never see his work in animated form. Spoiler: in ends badly.

6 May 2010 - Murmurings of an anime but admits he really doesn't know and there has been no concrete offer for one.

1 Apr 2013 - Says there's a Hoshi no Samidare anime but says it's a lie instantly. April Fool...

2 Jun 2014 - He dreamt of a Hoshi no Samidare anime.

26 May 2015 - Mizukami says that if he works hard enough, he hopes to have his works animated one day hopefully if an executive producer sponsors it.

26 May 2015 - An hour later, he mentions that at the end of Hoshi no Samidare series, there was possible talk of an anime but there was a lack of sponsors and it was dropped. (Rough Google TL). But he confirms he is waiting for a Hoshi no Samidare anime. .

29 Aug 2015 - He admits that getting a Hoshi no Samidare anime is impossible, mostly because it won't be enough to fit in 26 eps but about 32-33 episodes. Maybe its not suitable for anime after all :(

29 Aug 2015 - Basically gives up on Hoshi no Samidare anime saying that is destined to be a manga forever, with Spirit Circle seen as literature and Sengoku Inu seen as best for TV anime.

10 Dec 15 - Encourages people to vote for Hoshi no Samidare as a manga they want animated.

1 Mar 2016 - Hoshi no Samidare is voted as the no. 1 manga people want to be animated and he enthusiastically tweets, ANIME! ANIME! ANIME! The one that placed no. 2 eventually got one....

>>>

>>245256898
Worth noting that while we can read all of those in a vacuum, 20 years is an insane amount of time for an artist. Sure, some artists do almost the exact same thing forever, but some end up making drastic changed over time.
Shirow Masamune is a great example to that. Every couple of years you can expect a very different look from his works, even as a massive fan it is hard not to be partial to one or the other.
I recommend watching this video by saito naoki detailing his journey as an artist (english subs available). He went from an abstract horror artist to a baki fan artist to a moe character artist. I think it is very interesting to see how what someone wants to draw can change so dramatically over time.
https://youtu.be/pkbdcWgqAgU
